data.title: Lawyer
data.statement:
The time is vaguely around the present day, and there's a large problem: no-one wants to go to law school because the government put a new tax on being a lawyer or attorney!

So your objective is to make a program that can do the job without getting stuff wrong, by taking integers for minor crimes and a list of what the accused person or people have done, giving them a {{1}} year sentence for each <<minor crime>> they did, with exception <<felonies>> that give them a {{6}} year sentence instead.

testCases.title: Wait, One of them just did arson?
Tight Laws, But they are Innocent
Why are we arresting everyone in that club?????
Oh wait the clubs a drug cartel.
Why are there so many laws?

data.stubGenerator:
read laws:string(20)
read severeLaws:string(30)
read N:int
loop N read crimes:string(30)

write answer, I guess
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Integers separated by spaces for minor crimes, like pickpocketing.
<<Line 2:>> Integers separated by spaces for felonies, like arson.
<<Line 3:>> How many people are getting accused of crime ([[N]]).
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> Integers separated by spaces for what they have done, may have repeating values.
data.outputDescription: <<[[N]] lines:>> A number for how long they go to jail, in years.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The time is vaguely around the present day, and there's a large problem: no-one wants to go to law school because the government put a new tax on being a lawyer or attorney!

So your objective is to make a program that can do the job without getting stuff wrong, by taking integers for minor crimes and a list of what the accused person or people have done, giving them a 1 year sentence for each minor crime they did, with exception felonies that give them a 6 year sentence instead.
Input
Line 1: Integers separated by spaces for minor crimes, like pickpocketing.
Line 2: Integers separated by spaces for felonies, like arson.
Line 3: How many people are getting accused of crime (N).
Next N lines: Integers separated by spaces for what they have done, may have repeating values.
Output
N lines: A number for how long they go to jail, in years.
Constraints
1 <= N <= 100
Example
Input
1 3 9
5
1
4 8 1
Output
1
